unnormalised: So, someone asked about the admission process for Masters at IIT Bombay. Well, it's a bit of a process, but not impossible to crack! First off, you need a valid GATE score. Usually, they look at scores from the last 2-3 years, so a good score from GATE 2023 or GATE 2024 is usually acceptable. The cutoff marks vary depending on the department and your category (Gen, OBC, SC/ST). Keep an eye on their website, iitb.ac.in, for the official notifications.
normalised: So, someone asked about the admission process for Masters at I-I-T Bombay. Well, it's a bit of a process, but not impossible to crack! First off, you need a valid G-A-T-E score. Usually, they look at scores from the last two to three years, so a good score from G-A-T-E two thousand twenty three or G-A-T-E two thousand twenty four is usually acceptable. The cutoff marks vary depending on the department and your category G-e-n, O-B-C, S-C slash S-T. Keep an eye on their website, i-i-t-b dot a-c dot i-n, for the official notifications.

unnormalised: After GATE, shortlisted candidates will be called for an interview or a written test, or both! This depends on the specific department. For example, the CSE department might have a coding test followed by an interview, while other departments might just have an interview. They will grill you on your undergrad subjects, your projects, and your understanding of the fundamentals. Make sure you know your basics really well! Dates for interviews are usually announced in May/June.
normalised: After G-A-T-E, shortlisted candidates will be called for an interview or a written test, or both! This depends on the specific department. For example, the C-S-E department might have a coding test followed by an interview, while other departments might just have an interview. They will grill you on your undergrad subjects, your projects, and your understanding of the fundamentals. Make sure you know your basics really well! Dates for interviews are usually announced in May slash June.

unnormalised: Finally, the selection is based on a weighted average of your GATE score, performance in the interview/written test, and sometimes, your academic record. Keep checking the admission portal for updates. Documents like your 10th, 12th, and undergrad marksheets, GATE score card, and caste certificate (if applicable) need to be uploaded. All the best! You can do it!
normalised: Finally, the selection is based on a weighted average of your G-A-T-E score, performance in the interview slash written test, and sometimes, your academic record. Keep checking the admission portal for updates. Documents like your tenth, twelfth, and undergrad marksheets, G-A-T-E score card, and caste certificate (if applicable) need to be uploaded. All the best! You can do it!
